title: DeePen: Penetration Testing for Audio Deepfake Detection
author: Nicolas M. Muller (Fraunhofer AISEC), Piotr Kawa (Wrocław University of Science and Technology), Adriana Stan (Technical University of Cluj-Napoca), Thien-Phuc Doan (AISRC, Soongsil University), Souhwan Jung (AISRC, Soongsil University), Wei Herng Choong (Fraunhofer AISEC), Philip Sperl (Fraunhofer AISEC), Konstantin Bottinger (Fraunhofer AISEC), ...
relevance_why: The paper addresses vulnerabilities in audio deepfake detection systems, which can inform and enhance Dr. Liu's research on audio quality enhancement and the generation of realistic audio.
background: The research focuses on testing the resilience of audio deepfake detection models against various audio modifications to identify their vulnerabilities.
contribution: DeePen introduces a systematic methodology for evaluating audio deepfake detection models' robustness, revealing multiple vulnerabilities and demonstrating accessible audio manipulation techniques.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods lacked a structured approach to extensively test the robustness of detection systems against various realistic audio manipulations.
technical_comparison.novelty: This study employs an open-source tool to simulate real-world attacks on detection models without requiring insider knowledge of their architectures.

key_innovation: DeePen offers a comprehensive suite of audio modifications categorized as attacks, alongside a robust evaluation framework that reveals model vulnerabilities.
real_world_impact: The findings emphasize the need for continual advancements in audio deepfake detection technologies, which are critical for maintaining trust in media integrity and security across various sectors.
limitations: While some attacks can be mitigated by retraining, others remain effective, signaling the challenge of developing truly robust detection systems.

new_terms.deepfake: **Deepfake** refers to synthesized audio or video content that manipulates or fabricates reality, often used maliciously.
new_terms.penetration testing: **Penetration testing** is a simulated cyber attack against a system to evaluate its security and identify vulnerabilities.

open_sourcing: All associated code is available at https://github.com/Fraunhofer-AISEC/DeePen
